subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... ...  indirectly. Reflection is used inside JUnit, but you don t need to know about it to write tests, and just because it works fine for JUnit and plenty
messageBody:
On 2/6/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> but I wouldn't expect that from seasoned JUnit users, since it's a
> design they know and use.


... indirectly.

Reflection is used inside JUnit, but you don't need to know about it to
write tests, and just because it works fine for JUnit and plenty of other
products (application servers, servlet engines, etc...) doesn't mean that
one should forget the dangers associated to its usage.

Again, the point is that reflection is dangerous, not that it's useless.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
